segment.source: Save a file with a picker
segment.target: Save a file with a picker

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: FileSavePicker
segment.target: FileSavePicker

segment.source: StorageFile
segment.target: StorageFile

segment.source: Use FileSavePicker to let users specify the name and location where they want your app to save a file.
segment.target: Use FileSavePicker to let users specify the name and location where they want your app to save a file.

segment.source: Note Also see the File picker sample.
segment.target: Note Also see the File picker sample.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
segment.target: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

segment.source: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C\# or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic.
segment.target: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C\# or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic.

segment.source: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.
segment.target: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.

segment.source: Access permissions to the location
segment.target: Access permissions to the location

segment.source: See File access permissions.
segment.target: See File access permissions.

segment.source: FileSavePicker: step-by-step
segment.target: FileSavePicker: step-by-step

segment.source: Use a FileSavePicker so that your users can specify the name, type, and location of a file to save.
segment.target: Use a FileSavePicker so that your users can specify the name, type, and location of a file to save.

segment.source: Create, customize, and show a file picker object, and then save data via the returned StorageFile object that represents the file picked.
segment.target: Create, customize, and show a file picker object, and then save data via the returned StorageFile object that represents the file picked.

segment.source: Create and customize the FileSavePicker
segment.target: Create and customize the FileSavePicker

segment.source: Set properties on the file picker object that are relevant to your users and your app.
segment.target: Set properties on the file picker object that are relevant to your users and your app.

segment.source: For guidelines to help you decide how to customize the file picker, see Guidelines and checklist for file pickers.
segment.target: For guidelines to help you decide how to customize the file picker, see Guidelines and checklist for file pickers.

segment.source: This example sets three properties: SuggestedStartLocation, FileTypeChoices and SuggestedFileName.
segment.target: This example sets three properties: SuggestedStartLocation, FileTypeChoices and SuggestedFileName.

segment.source: Note FileSavePicker objects display the file picker using the PickerViewMode.List.
segment.target: Note FileSavePicker objects display the file picker using the PickerViewMode.List.

segment.source: Because our user is saving a document or text file, the sample sets SuggestedStartLocation to the app's local folder by using LocalFolder.
segment.target: Because our user is saving a document or text file, the sample sets SuggestedStartLocation to the app's local folder by using LocalFolder.

segment.source: Set SuggestedStartLocation to a location appropriate for the type of file being saved, for example Music, Pictures, Videos, or Documents.
segment.target: Set SuggestedStartLocation to a location appropriate for the type of file being saved, for example Music, Pictures, Videos, or Documents.

segment.source: From the start location, the user can navigate to other locations.
segment.target: From the start location, the user can navigate to other locations.

segment.source: Because we want to make sure our app can open the file after it is saved, we use FileTypeChoices to specify file types that the sample supports (Microsoft Word documents and text files).
segment.target: Because we want to make sure our app can open the file after it is saved, we use FileTypeChoices to specify file types that the sample supports (Microsoft Word documents and text files).

segment.source: Make sure all the file types that you specify are supported by your app.
segment.target: Make sure all the file types that you specify are supported by your app.

segment.source: Users will be able to save their file as any of the file types you specify.
segment.target: Users will be able to save their file as any of the file types you specify.

segment.source: They can also change the file type by selecting another of the file types that you specified.
segment.target: They can also change the file type by selecting another of the file types that you specified.

segment.source: The first file type choice in the list will be selected by default: to control that, set the DefaultFileExtension property.
segment.target: The first file type choice in the list will be selected by default: to control that, set the DefaultFileExtension property.

segment.source: Note The file picker also uses the currently selected file type to filter which files it displays, so that only file types that match the selected files types are displayed to the user.
segment.target: Note The file picker also uses the currently selected file type to filter which files it displays, so that only file types that match the selected files types are displayed to the user.

segment.source: To save the user some typing, the example sets a SuggestedFileName.
segment.target: To save the user some typing, the example sets a SuggestedFileName.

segment.source: Make your suggested file name relevant to the file being saved.
segment.target: Make your suggested file name relevant to the file being saved.

segment.source: For example, like Word, you can suggest the existing file name if there is one, or the first line of a document if the user is saving a file that does not yet have a name.
segment.target: For example, like Word, you can suggest the existing file name if there is one, or the first line of a document if the user is saving a file that does not yet have a name.

segment.source: Show the FileSavePicker and save to the picked file
segment.target: Show the FileSavePicker and save to the picked file

segment.source: Display the file picker by calling PickSaveFileAsync.
segment.target: Display the file picker by calling PickSaveFileAsync.

segment.source: After the user specifies the name, file type, and location, and confirms to save the file, PickSaveFileAsync returns a StorageFile object that represents the saved file.
segment.target: After the user specifies the name, file type, and location, and confirms to save the file, PickSaveFileAsync returns a StorageFile object that represents the saved file.

segment.source: You can capture and process this file now that you have read and write access to it.
segment.target: You can capture and process this file now that you have read and write access to it.

segment.source: The example checks that the file is valid and writes its own file name into it.
segment.target: The example checks that the file is valid and writes its own file name into it.

segment.source: Also see Creating, writing, and reading a file.
segment.target: Also see Creating, writing, and reading a file.

segment.source: Tip You should always check the saved file to make sure it is valid before you perform any other processing.
segment.target: Tip You should always check the saved file to make sure it is valid before you perform any other processing.

segment.source: Then, you can save content to the file as appropriate for your app, and provide appropriate behavior if the picked file is not valid.
segment.target: Then, you can save content to the file as appropriate for your app, and provide appropriate behavior if the picked file is not valid.
